Ingest_LDD.name: Atmosphere
Ingest_LDD.comment: This dictionary describes the modeling output generic variables

DD_Attribute.name: type
DD_Attribute.definition: Model Type (e.g GCM, MESOSCALE, ASSIMILATION)

DD_Attribute.name: name
DD_Attribute.definition: Describes the name of the model (e.g NASA Ames Mars MGCM)

DD_Attribute.name: version
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifies the specific version of the model (e.g v3.0)

DD_Attribute.name: institution
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifies the host institution or author of the model

DD_Attribute.name: horizontal_grid_type
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifies the native horizontal grid of the model (e.g lat/lon, cube sphere, etc)

DD_Attribute.name: model_resolution
DD_Attribute.definition: identifies the horizontal resolution (dx,dy) of the model in km, m, degrees.

DD_Attribute.name: model_resolution_unit
DD_Attribute.definition: identifies the unit of the horizontal grid km, m, degrees.

DD_Attribute.name: vertical_grid_type
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifies the vertical grid type (e.g. SIGMA, HYBRID-SIGMA, ALTITUDE, PRESSURE)

DD_Attribute.name: vertical_grid_unit
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifies the unit of the vertical grid type (e.g. Pa, mbar, km, m)

DD_Attribute.name: model_timestep
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifies the base model timestep

DD_Attribute.name: model_timestep_unit
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifies the unit of the base model timestep

DD_Attribute.name: upper_boundary
DD_Attribute.definition: The lower_boundary attribute provides the top most coverage limit in levels such as pressure

DD_Attribute.name: lower_boundary
DD_Attribute.definition: The lower_boundary attribute provides the bottom most coverage limit in levels such as pressure

DD_Attribute.name: northern_boundary
DD_Attribute.definition: The northern_boundary attribute provides the northern most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in latitude.

DD_Attribute.name: southern_boundary
DD_Attribute.definition: The southern_boundary attribute provides the southern most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in latitude.

DD_Attribute.name: eastern_boundary
DD_Attribute.definition: The eastern_boundary attribute provides the eastern most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in longitude

DD_Attribute.name: western_boundary
DD_Attribute.definition: The western_boundary attribute provides the western most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in longitude.

DD_Attribute.name: start_time
DD_Attribute.definition: The start_time attribute provides the coverage start time expressed in any format of time

DD_Attribute.name: end_time
DD_Attribute.definition: The end_time attribute provides the coverage end time expressed in any format of time.

DD_Attribute.name: top_level
DD_Attribute.definition: The top_level attribute provides the top most coverage expressed in pressure level

DD_Attribute.name: bottom_level
DD_Attribute.definition: The bottom_level attribute provides the bottom most coverage expressed in pressure level.

DD_Attribute.name: postprocessing_methods
DD_Attribute.definition: a description of post-processing operating on all data in the file, including time mean, interpolation etc. Methodology can be described in text or using netcdf standard recommendations for cell_methods (e.g. for a zonal time-mean with a three hour interval, 'time:mean(interval=3 hours) longitude:mean'

DD_Attribute.name: variable_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The name of the variable in the file

DD_Attribute.name: long_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The long name of the variable in the file

DD_Attribute.name: fieldnam
DD_Attribute.definition: A description of the variable (up to 30 characters).

DD_Attribute.name: standard_name
DD_Attribute.definition: Optional Attribute to identify the variable with a specific standard name (see python script add metadata)

DD_Attribute.name: dimensions
DD_Attribute.definition: The dimensions of the variable in the file

DD_Attribute.name: dim_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The names of dimensions the variable in the file

DD_Attribute.name: units
DD_Attribute.definition: The unit of the variable in the file

DD_Attribute.name: level_type
DD_Attribute.definition: level/model/height at which variable is outputted

DD_Attribute.name: validmin
DD_Attribute.definition: The minimum valid value for a variable.

DD_Attribute.name: validmax
DD_Attribute.definition: The maximum valid value for a variable.

DD_Attribute.name: missing_value
DD_Attribute.definition: The unit of the variable in the file

DD_Attribute.name: scale_factor
DD_Attribute.definition: scale factor provides the multiplier to the packed value, unpacked_value=packed_value * scale_factor + add_offset

DD_Attribute.name: add_offset
DD_Attribute.definition: add_offset if there is any; scale factor and add offset are used to reduce the storage space of packed variable unpacked_value = packed_value * scale_factor + add_offset

DD_Attribute.name: stagger
DD_Attribute.definition: The unit of the variable in the file

DD_Attribute.name: memory_order
DD_Attribute.definition: The dimensions of the variable in the file

DD_Attribute.name: catdesk
DD_Attribute.definition: Approximately 80-character string which is a textual description of the variable

DD_Attribute.name: format
DD_Attribute.definition: The format of the variable in the file

DD_Attribute.name: monoton
DD_Attribute.definition: Whether the variable is monotonically increasing or monotonically decreasing. A value of INCREASE indicates strictly increasing values, DECREASE strictly decreasing values, or FALSE indicates not monotonic

DD_Attribute.name: fillval
DD_Attribute.definition: The value used for missing or invalid variable values.

DD_Attribute.name: description
DD_Attribute.definition: any additional description of the variable, processing, etc

DD_Attribute.name: var_type
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifies a variable as either data, support_data, metadata or ignore_data.

DD_Attribute.name: cell_methods
DD_Attribute.definition: ia string attribute comprising a list of blank-separated words of the form "name: method". Each "name: method" pair indicates that for an axis identified by name, the cell values representing the field have been determined or derived by the specified method. For example, if data values have been generated by computing time means, then this could be indicated with cell_methods="time:mean(interval=2 hours)"

DD_Attribute.name: formula_terms
DD_Attribute.definition: an attribute used to associate terms in the definitions with variables in a netCDF file

DD_Attribute.name: coord_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The name of the variable in the file

DD_Attribute.name: axis
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifies latitude, longitude, vertical, or time axes.

DD_Attribute.name: positive
DD_Attribute.definition: the direction in which the coordinate values are increasing

DD_Attribute.name: calendar
DD_Attribute.definition: In order to calculate a new date and time given a base date, base time and a time increment one must know what calendar to use. For this purpose we recommend that the calendar be specified by the attribute calendar which is assigned to the time coordinate variable.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Mixed Gregorian/Julian calendar as defined by Udunits. This is the default. (Same as Standard.)
Mixed Gregorian/Julian calendar as defined by Udunits. This is the default. (Same as Gregorian.)
A Gregorian calendar extended to dates before 1582-10-15. That is, a year is a leap year if either (i) it is divisible by 4 but not by 100 or (ii) it is divisible by 400.
Gregorian calendar without leap years, i.e., all years are 365 days long. (Same as 365_Day.)
Gregorian calendar without leap years, i.e., all years are 365 days long. (Same as Noleap.)
Gregorian calendar with every year being a leap year, i.e., all years are 366 days long. (Same as 366_Day.)
Gregorian calendar with every year being a leap year, i.e., all years are 366 days long. (Same as All_Leap.)
All years are 360 days divided into 30 day months.

DD_Attribute.name: day_length
DD_Attribute.definition: The unit of the variable in the file

DD_Attribute.name: month_length
DD_Attribute.definition: If none of the calendar types apply, a non-standard calendar can be defined. The user must explicitly define the number of days per month

DD_Attribute.name: maximum_boundary
DD_Attribute.definition: the maximum boundary of the coordinate

DD_Attribute.name: minimum_boundary
DD_Attribute.definition: the minimum boundary of the coordinate

DD_Class.name: Model_Metadata
DD_Class.definition: The Model_Metadata class contains those attributes and sub-classes that describe the model metadata. Metadata is anything that describes the model and specific simulation configuration that is not described by dimensions, coordinates or variables included in the data product.

DD_Class.name: Simulation_Configuration
DD_Class.definition: The Simulation_Configuration sub-class contains attributes that describe the specific simulation configuration that is not described by dimensions, coordinates or variables included in the data product. This class specifically describes the simulation configuration at runtime, not the data structure after processing (e.g. it provides the native vertical coordinate while the model output files may be interpolated to a new vertical grid

DD_Class.name: File_Description
DD_Class.definition: The file_description sub-class contains attributes that describe the specific file, rather than the original simulation. The intention is to make the data searchable, e.g for a specific location or time of year.

DD_Class.name: Variable
DD_Class.definition: The variable sub-class contains attributes that describe variables and coordinates in external data files.These attributes should be populated automatically for each variable using the python script (readmetadata)

DD_Class.name: Coordinate
DD_Class.definition: The coordinate sub-class contains attributes that describe coordinates in external data files.These attributes should be populated automatically for each variable using the python script (readmetadata)

DD_Class.name: Model_Output
DD_Class.definition: The Model_Output class contains those attributes and sub-classes that describe the model output. Model output includes coordinate, dimensions and variable products as well as information about variable processing, for example, to generate figure data. Most attributes are generated automatically from the python script

DD_Class.name: AMA
DD_Class.definition: This is the umbrella class for the AMA (Atmospheric Modeling Annex) local dictionary.
